comments.body: nit: you'll want to balance the ending `)` (add a newline before it)
strike that :) no newline here is correct
I tend to avoid factory ctos unless I'm using it to return one of a few different subclasses. You might want to use a static method here, or have an `_init` method that both ctors called into.
This URl could be null, which wouldn't change after running pub get ... took me a while to see
I think we need to wait until well after 1.20 is released to give the plugin consumers time to upgrade (not just the plugin author)

pub is adding a check for non-iOS plugins to not able to publish if they don't set the min SDK constraint to 1.20.0 and they don't have iOS folders. This prevents the app authors from hitting the error if they haven't upgraded to 1.20.0
Can we add logging, or metrics for this?

Just curious, if `(context['android'] as bool?)` is null, is `null == true` legal? Does `null == true` just return false?

Based on the previous code, I think it is safe to just force unwrap here. The previous wasn't expect a null value. So maybe:
```
final bool android = context['android']! as bool;
```

There's no guarantee `android` is set.  Like it's not set here:
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/91ed4b2082d1b6b847ade39d94bcaad48bb8f722/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/project.dart#L787-L793

So if it's not passed in then `context['android']` is null.  So if it's null or false, it should bail from this method and return `null`.  Right?
Ah i see, you are right. Maybe `context['android'] as bool? ?? false` is a clearer way to do it? Your call tho.
We have ` == true` all over this code to check if it's true and not null or false.
